cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Gradually slowing, then turning WNW and west toward the southern North Carolina / northern South Carolina coast before stalling inland and drifting west-southwest, eventually curving northward into the Appalachians early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch north of Duck NC to the NC/VA border; Hurricane Watch Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA including lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Carolina coasts, southeastern Virginia and portions of the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (â‰¤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty breezes possible early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Delaware River or South Jersey shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to occasionally moderate rain bands possible 16-18 Sep as the remnant low passes inland
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the New Jersey coast through the weekend
